# Search Guard Documentation

> Search Guard is an Enterprise Security Suite for Elasticsearch and OpenSearch, providing authentication, authorization, encryption, audit logging, and compliance features. Official documentation at https://docs.search-guard.com/latest/

Search Guard protects your Elasticsearch and OpenSearch clusters with a comprehensive security solution. It offers TLS encryption, multiple authentication methods (LDAP, Active Directory, Kerberos, JWT, SAML, OpenID Connect), fine-grained access control, Document-Level Security, Field-Level Security, audit logging, and compliance features.

This documentation covers all Search Guard features across Community and Enterprise editions, including the Signals Alerting plugin, Automated Index Management (AIM), Encryption at Rest, and Anomaly Detection modules.

**Technology Stack:** Jekyll 4.2.0 static site generator, Ruby 3.0, Kramdown (GFM), Algolia search integration

**Editions:** Community (free), Compliance, Enterprise - each with progressive feature sets

## Core Documentation

[Security for Elasticsearch](security-for-elasticsearch): Overview of Search Guard's security features and architecture
[Main Concepts](main-concepts): Core security concepts including users, roles, permissions, and tenants
[Getting Started](search-guard-getting-started): Quick start guide for new users
[Installation and Setup](search-guard-installation-setup): Complete installation guide for Search Guard
[Demo Installer](demo-installer): Quickly set up Search Guard with sample configuration
[Security Guided Tour](first-steps-user-auth): Step-by-step walkthrough of Search Guard features

[Search Guard Installation](search-guard-installation): Detailed installation instructions

[TLS Tool](tls-tool): Generate certificates and TLS configuration
[TLS Troubleshooting](troubleshooting-tls): Debug TLS/SSL issues
[Configuration Tools](search-guard-configuration-tools): Overview of sgctl CLI, GUI, and REST API

[Hot Reload](search-guard-hot-reload): Apply configuration changes without restart

## Authentication

[Authentication Methods](authentication-methods): Overview of all supported authentication methods
[Authentication Configuration](authentication-authorization-configuration): Configure authentication backends
[Internal Users Database](internal-users-database): Built-in user management
[Active Directory and LDAP](active-directory-ldap): Authenticate users against Active Directory or LDAP
[HTTP Basic Authorization](http-basic-authorization): Simple username/password authentication
[Proxy Authentication](proxy-authentication): Authenticate via reverse proxy headers
[JSON Web Tokens (JWT)](jwt-json-web-tokens): Token-based authentication
[SAML](saml): SAML 2.0 Single Sign-On integration
[OpenID Connect](openid-connect): OpenID Connect authentication
[Kerberos](kerberos): Kerberos/SPNEGO authentication
[Client Certificates](tls-client-authentication): X.509 client certificate authentication
[Multi-Factor Authentication](multi-factor-authentication): Add MFA to authentication flows

[Testing Configuration](first-steps-testing-configuration): Verify role and permission configuration
[User Impersonation](user-impersonation): Act on behalf of other users

[Fine-Grained Access Control](search-guard-fine-grained-access): Overview of DLS and FLS
[Document-Level Security](document-level-security): Restrict access to specific documents
[Field-Level Security](field-level-security): Hide or anonymize specific fields
[Advanced DLS](advanced-dls): Advanced Document-Level Security features including DLS for data streams
[Field Anonymization](field-anonymization): Hash or mask sensitive fields
[DLS/FLS Performance](dls-fls-performance): Performance considerations

[Jira Actions](elasticsearch-alerting-actions-jira): Create Jira issues (Enterprise)

[Throttling and Acknowledgement](elasticsearch-alerting-throttling): Prevent alert spam
[Trust Stores](elasticsearch-alerting-trust-stores): Configure trusted certificates for HTTPS
[Proxies](elasticsearch-alerting-proxies): Configure HTTP proxies
[Scripting](signals-alerting-scripting): Painless scripting in watches

[Watch State](elasticsearch-alerting-rest-api-watch-state): Get watch execution state
[Account Management](elasticsearch-alerting-rest-api-account-put): Manage accounts via API

## Automated Index Management (AIM)

[AIM Overview](automated-index-management-getting-started): Getting started with Automated Index Management
[How AIM Works](how-automated-index-management-works): Architecture and execution model
[Index Policies](automated-index-management-policies): Define lifecycle policies for indices

### Conditions

[Conditions Overview](automated-index-management-conditions-overview): Time and metric-based conditions
[Index Age](automated-index-management-conditions-index-age): Trigger based on index age
[Index Size](automated-index-management-conditions-index-size): Trigger based on index size
[Index Count](automated-index-management-conditions-index-count): Trigger based on document count
[Cron Schedule](automated-index-management-conditions-cron-schedule): Time-based scheduling

### Actions

[Actions Overview](automated-index-management-actions-overview): Index lifecycle actions
[Rollover](automated-index-management-actions-rollover): Roll over to new index
[Delete](automated-index-management-actions-delete): Delete old indices
[Force Merge](automated-index-management-actions-force-merge): Optimize index segments
[Snapshot](automated-index-management-actions-snapshot): Create index snapshots
[Set Read-Only](automated-index-management-actions-set-read-only): Make index read-only
[Replica Count](automated-index-management-actions-replica-count): Adjust replica count
[Index Priority](automated-index-management-actions-index-priority): Set recovery priority
[Close Index](automated-index-management-actions-close): Close indices
[Shrink](automated-index-management-actions-shrink): Reduce shard count

### REST API and Configuration

[AIM REST API Overview](automated-index-management-rest-overview): API documentation
[Create Policy](automated-index-management-rest-create): Create or update policy
[Get Policy](automated-index-management-rest-get): Retrieve policy configuration
[Delete Policy](automated-index-management-rest-delete): Remove policy
[Attach Policy](automated-index-management-rest-attach): Assign policy to indices
[Explain](automated-index-management-rest-explain): View policy status
[Settings](automated-index-management-settings): Configure AIM behavior
[Security](automated-index-management-security): Permissions for AIM

### Community Resources

Search Guard website: https://search-guard.com
Support Forum: https://forum.search-guard.com
GitHub Issues: https://github.com/floragunncom/search-guard
Elasticsearch Compatibility: Versions 6.x through 8.x supported
